description._content: Stacy, George,, photographer. Camp Hamilton, Fortress Monroe, Va. [1861] 1 photographic print on stereo card : stereograph, albumen ; 3.25 x 6.75 in. Notes: Stereograph shows tents and soldiers, including in background a group of Zouaves and a group of drummer boys. According to Zeller, "This 1861 view shows the camp of the 5th New York Zouaves." (Source: Civil War in Depth, by Bob Zeller, 2000, v. 2, p. 61) Attributed to George Stacy. No. GCW 25A. No. 629. Title from item. Forms part of: Civil War Photograph Collection (Library of Congress). Hand-colored version of this card published in: The Civil War in depth / Bob Zeller. San Francisco: Chronicle Books, 1997-2000, v. 2, p. 61. Subjects: Tents--Virginia--Fort Monroe--1860-1870. Zouaves--Union--1860-1870. Fort Monroe (Va.)--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Military facilities--Union. Format: Stereographs--1860-1870. Albumen prints--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.1s01811 hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.2s01811 Call Number: Unprocessed in PR13 CN 2008:007 [item]
